results.title: Primary education in England
results.brief_description: The Sea Mills Infant School in Bristol, one of the leading infant schools in England, is seen as an extension of the environment of home and family. This documentary film follows the interaction of teacher and children as the children’s energies and interests are directed toward self-selected learning activities. Suitable for teacher training. Narrated by Kathleen Brearley Andrews.

results.title: Primary colors
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Mutual Film Company and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Jack Stanton is a governor from a small southern state who, while sincere in his devotion to the American people, is nevertheless plagued by scandal at every twist on the campaign trail to the presidency. Includes music score by Ry Cooder. Cast includes John Travolta, Emma Thompson, Billy Bob Thornton, Kathy Bates, Adrian Lester, Larry Hagman and Diane Ladd.

results.title: Priit Parn: selected films
results.brief_description: This tape features three films from the award winning Estonian animation director and political cartoonist, Priit Parn. An artist who uses animation to satirise and parody the old Soviet system and the conflicting outcomes of Perestroika. His films are rich with repetition and allusion, and as with much Eastern European animation, is laden with symbolism. “Time out” follows the antics of a hero cat (produced by Hille Koosk); “Breakfast on the grass” provides a parallel with Manet’s work and reveals bureaucracy at its most malign (produced by Tallinnfilm); “Hotel E” explores the process of Glasnost, using a hotel setting as a metaphor for East and West (produced by Olav Osolin).

results.title: Priest
results.creator_credit: Antonia Bird, George Faber, Josephine Ward, BBC, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment and Electric Pictures (Aust)
results.brief_description: A young priest tests his faith and vocation when assigned to a working class Parish in Liverpool. When a teenage girl confesses of her father’s incestuous advances, he is torn by the rituals of a Church which swears him to silence and to which he owes obedience, and his innate sense of justice. This conflict is compounded by his struggle with his own desires and sexuality as he enters into an illicit homosexual relationship. Linus Roache is excellent and well supported by a cast including Tom Wilkinson, Cathy Tyson and Robert Carlyle. “Priest” does not seek to attack organised religion; instead it offers a window into the heart and mind of a believer who struggles daily with his faith and vocation to find a true path.

results.title: Pride and prejudice. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Simon Langton, Sue Birtwistle, Arts Entertainment Network and BBC
results.brief_description: Jane Austen’s famous novel is brought to life in this vibrant, fresh adaptation. Full of energy, the script, performances, sets, locations and costume design are excellent, while the overall production veers away from the formality of previous adaptations. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle are Darcy and Elizabeth and they are joined by a large and well-known cast including Barbara Leigh Hunt, Alison Steadman, Julia Sawalha and Susannah Harker. The underlying initial tension between Elizabeth and Darcy, develops into love, and their faults; pride on his part and prejudice on hers, blossoms into a deep and lasting mutual respect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simon Langton, Sue Birtwistle, Arts Entertainment Network and BBC
